title: Registration guide for Remote Gaming Duty

details.body:
Overview

If you’re not already paying Remote Gaming Duty (RGD) but you’ll be liable from 1 December 2014, you’ll need to register before then.

HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) will open their full online registration service on 3 November 2014.

But, if you want to, you can get started with the registration process before then using our online form. This guidance is to help you fill in that form.

Registration

If you’re already paying RGD, HMRC has already written to you explaining you don’t need to register.

Appointing an agent

If you would like someone, such as an accountant or other agent, to act for you, let HMRC know when you fill in the online registration application. HMRC will contact you and ask you to provide further details.

Partnerships

If you need to register a partnership you can tell HMRC when you fill in your online registration application. HMRC will contact you for further details.

Group registration

If you want to apply for group registration you can tell HMRC when you fill in the online registration application form. HMRC will then contact you and ask for further details. If you need to register as a Group, the Group Lead Member must complete the registration.

Representatives.

If you need to appoint a representative you should tell HMRC when you fill in the online registration application. HMRC will contact you for further details.

More information about representatives can be found in the how to appoint a representative in the UK guide.

What you’ll need to register

This depends on your business type. Select the business type from the table below and make sure you have all the information you need before you start your application.

Business type - if you’re a What you’ll need to complete online registration
Sole proprietor Trading name
  Date of birth
  National Insurance Number
  HMRC Unique Taxpayer reference - if held (the Unique Taxpayer Reference (UTR) will have been issued by HMRC when registering for self assessment, it’s made up of ten numbers, for example 1234567890
  UK VAT registration number (if held - the registration number is made up of 9 digits, for example 123 4567 89)
  Principal place of business
  Contactable telephone number
  Contactable email address - please use the standard recognised format for email addresses, for example:
firstname.lastname@domain.com
  Date taxable betting started or is due to start (this will be on or after 1 December 2014)
  Correspondence address
  Expected annual taxable profit from any profit from any:
-off course betting
-spread betting
-setting exchange activity
Partnership UK VAT registration number (if held)
  Organisation name
  Trading name if different to the organisation name
  Principal place of business
  Contactable telephone number
  Contactable email address - please use the standard recognised format for email addresses, for example:
firstname.lastname@domain.com
  Date taxable betting started or is due to start (this will be on or after 1 December 2014)
  Correspondence address
  Expected annual taxable profit from any:
-off course betting
-pread betting
-Betting exchange activity
Corporate body (UK) UK VAT registration number (if held)
  HMRC Unique Taxpayer reference (if held - the Unique Taxpayer Reference (UTR) will have been issued by HMRC when registering for Corporation Tax, it’s made up of ten numbers, for example 1234567890.
  Organisation name
  Trading name if different to the organisation name
  Principal place of business
  Contactable telephone number
  Contactable email address - please use the standard recognised format for email addresses, for example:
firstname.lastname@domain.com
  Date taxable betting started or is due to start (this will be on or after 1 December 2014)
  Correspondence address
  Expected annual taxable profit from any: off course betting, spread betting, betting exchange activity
Corporate body (non-UK) Trading name if different to the organisation name
  Principal place of business
  Contactable telephone number
  Contactable email address - please use the standard recognised format for email addresses, for example:
firstname.lastname@domain.com
  Date taxable betting started or is due to start (this will be on or after 1 December 2014)
  Correspondence address
  Expected annual taxable profit from any:
-off course betting
-Spread betting
-Betting exchange activity

After you’ve registered

When HMRC receive your registration application they’ll send you an acknowledgment by email. HMRC will contact you if you need to send more information about your application or you’ve indicated that you want to:

  • register a partnership or group
  • nominate a fiscal or admin representative
  • appoint an agent

If HMRC do need to ask for further information they’ll contact you within 14 days of submitting your application.

When HMRC have completed the application process they’ll let you know if your application has been approved and issue a registration certificate before 1 December 2014.
